message.content: This question requires knowledge about angler fish and their hunting methods. Angler fish are known for using a bioluminescent lure to attract prey. They have a built-in specific illumination mechanism that helps them attract smaller fish towards their mouth. Option (A) is incorrect because angler fish do not rely on human fishermen to catch prey for them. Option (B) is incorrect because they do not use spear guns. Option (D) is incorrect because they do not use fishing poles as humans do.

They have a specialized organ called an esca or illicium that emits light to attract their prey. The prey is then captured using their sharp teeth or jaws. Option (A) is incorrect because angler fish do not rely on human fishermen to hunt. Option (B) is incorrect because angler fish do not use spear guns. Option (D) is incorrect because angler fish do not use fishing poles.
